acos.description: Returns the principal value of the arc cosine of x, expressed in radians.

adddeaths.description: Adds number of deaths to player. (Can be also negative).

addkills.description: Give or take kills from the player.

adminrights.description: Gets the admin rights of the player (Reborn ClientAdmin System).

asin.description: Returns the principal value of the arc sine of x, expressed in radians.

atan.description: Reborn: Returns the principal value of the arc tangent of y/x, expressed in radians. Breakthrough: ArcTangent of float (in degrees, not radians).

atan2.description:
Returns the principal value of the arc tangent of y/x, expressed in radians.
To compute the value, the function uses the sign of both arguments to determine the quadrant.

bindweap.description:
Binds weapon to player. Sets him as weapon owner.
2nd use of the command will unbind the weapon from player.
bindweap.example:
local.player bindweap local.weapon
local.weapon anim "fire"
local.player bindweap local.weapon

ceil.description: Returns the smallest integral value that is not less than x.

chartoint.description:
Converts an ASCII character to its decimal
equivalent and returns that as an integer value.

conprintf.description: Prints text to the console without a new line at the end.
conprintf.example: conprintf "This can be a custom error message from the script\n"

cos.description: Reborn: Returns the cosine of an angle of x radians. Breakthrough: Cosine of float (expects degrees not radians).

cosh.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.

exp.description:
Returns the base-e exponential function of x,
which is the e number raised to the power x.

fclose.description:
Closes file.

If file is successfully closed, a zero value is returned.
On failure, EOF is returned.

fcopy.description:
Creates a copy of file.
If the file is successfully copied, a zero value is returned.
When function fails to open original file, a -1 value is returned.
When function fails to create a second file, a -2 value is returned.
When function fails during data copy process, a -3 value is returned.

feof.description:
Checks for end of file.
A non-zero value is returned in the case that the
End-of-File indicator associated with the file is set.
Otherwise, a zero value is returned.

ferror.description:
Checks if the error indicator associated with file is set,
returning a value different from zero if it is.

If the error indicator associated with the file was set,
the function returns a nonzero value.
Otherwise, it returns a zero value.

fexists.description:
Checks if file with given filename exists.

If file exists, function returns 1. Otherwise it returns 0.

fflush.description:
If the given file was open for writing and the last i/o operation was an output operation,
any unwritten data in the output buffer is written to the file.
The file remains open after this command.

A zero value indicates success.
If an error occurs, EOF is returned and the error indicator is set.

fgetc.description:
Reads single character from file.

The character read is returned as an int value.
You need to cast it to char if you want to use it in string.

fgets.description:
Reads string line from file.
maxbuffsize - specifies maximum buffer size that will be allocated to store the string in memory.

If the End-of-File is encountered and no characters have been read 0 (null) is returned.
If an error occurs 0 (null) is returned.
If a memory allocation error occurs, -1 is returned.

flist.syntax: flist( String path, String extension, Integer scanSubDirectories )
flist.description:
Returns a list (array) of files with given extension located in given path.
Function handles .pk3 folder structure and normal system directories.
When scanSubDirectories equals 1, function will include subdirectories located under directory path.
Extension needs to have "." (dot) included. Otherwise it will act as filter.

floor.description: Returns the largest integral value that is not greater than x.

fmod.description:
Returns the floating-point remainder of numerator/denominator.

The remainder of a division operation is the result of subtracting
the integral quotient multiplied by the denominator from the numerator:
remainder = numerator - quotient * denominator

fnewdir.description:
Creates a new directory with given dirname.

Result:
 0 = Success
 -1 = Error, directory already exists

fopen.description: Opens file (ANSI C - fopen). Returns file handle that is needed for identification and further operations on this file.

fputc.description:
Writes a character to the file and advances the position indicator.
If there are no errors, the same character that has been written is returned.
If an error occurs, EOF is returned and the error indicator is set.
You have to cast returned value to char.
If you pass longer string, only first character will be written to file.

fputs.description:
Writes text to the file and advances the position indicator.
On success, a non-negative value is returned.
On error, the function returns EOF.
fputs.example: local.result = fputs local.filehandle "This is an example"

freadall.description:
Reads whole file into a string at once. File has to be opened in binary mode (rb, rb+)

Don't read binary files with this function because it may cause memory leaks.

freadpak.description:
Reads file located inside .pk3 file in text mode and returns it's content as string.

If the file is successfully read, function returns a string with it's content.
When function fails to find, open or read a file from .pk3, a -1 value is returned.

fremove.description:
Removes the file with given filename.

If the file is successfully deleted, a zero value is returned.
On failure, a nonzero value is returned and the errno variable
is set to the corresponding error code.

fremovedir.description:
Removes the directory with given dirname.

Result:
0 = Success
-1 = Error, directory doesn't exists or contains files in it

frename.description:
Renames the file with given filename.

If the file is successfully renamed, a zero value is returned.
On failure, a nonzero value is returned and the errno variable
is set to the corresponding error code.

frewind.description: Sets the position indicator associated with file to the beginning of the file.

frexp.description:
Breaks the floating point number x into its binary significand
(a floating point value between 0.5(included) and 1.0(excluded))
and an integral exponent for 2, such that:
x = significand * 2exponent

If x is zero, both parts (significand and exponent) are zero.
frexp.example:
local.result = frexp local.x
// Result
local.result["significand"] // Significand part
local.result["exponent"] // Exponent part

fsaveall.description:
Writes string content to file at once.
File has to be opened in binary mode (wb, wb+, ab).
The content will start to be saved from the current file position.

Function returns number of character written to file or -1 if content is NULL.

fseek.syntax: fseek( Integer filehandle, Integer offset, Integer origin )
fseek.description:
Sets the position indicator associated with the file to a new position
defined by adding offset to a reference position specified by origin.

origin:
0 = SEEK_SET
1 = SEEK_CUR

If successful, the function returns a zero value.
Otherwise, it returns nonzero value.

ftell.description:
Returns the current value of the position indicator of the file.

On success, the current value of the position indicator is returned.
If an error occurs, -1 is returned.

getactiveweap.description: Gets currently active weapon from player's hand of given index.

getclientnum.description: Gets player's client number and returns it as integer.

getconnstate.description:
Gets state of player's connection.

Returns integer value:
0 = CS_FREE - given player slot is free
1 = CS_ZOMBIE - given player slot is in zombie state (his data is still kept after he disconnected or lost connection)
2 = CS_CONNECTED - player has connected to server, but he's not yet in the game
3 = CS_PRIMED - player has passed through authorization checks and finished downloading any missing files
4 = CS_ACTIVE - player is in game and can start playing

getdate.description: Gets current date in format given as parameter. Max format length is 512 characters. Formatting options: strftime

getdeaths.description:
Gets number of player's deaths and returns it as integer.

Warning:
When g_gametype is 3 or 4, deaths aren't counted and result
of this function will equal to kills amount that player has.

getentity.description: Returns entity with given entity number.

getip.description: Gets player's ip address with port and returns it as string.

getkills.description: Gets number of player's kills and returns it as integer.

getping.description: Gets player's ping and returns it as integer.

getproperty.description:
Gets property saved in local storage for given key.
Returns value as string or error code as integer.

key can't be NULL.

gettime.description: Gets current time in format: H:M:S

ihuddraw_align.syntax: ihuddraw_align( Entity player, Integer index, String h_align, String v_align )
ihuddraw_align.description:
Sets the alignment of a huddraw element for individual player.
Specified with:
"left", "center" or "right" for horizontal alignment
"top", "center" or "bottom" for vertical alignment.

ihuddraw_alpha.syntax: ihuddraw_alpha( Entity player, Integer index, Float alpha )
ihuddraw_alpha.description: Sets the alpha of a huddraw element for individual player.

ihuddraw_color.syntax: ihuddraw_color( Entity player, Integer index, Float red, Float green, Float blue )
ihuddraw_color.description:
Sets the color for a huddraw element for individual player.
RGB (red, green, blue) format. From 0 to 1.

ihuddraw_font.syntax: ihuddraw_font( Entity player, Integer index, String fontname )
ihuddraw_font.description:
Sets the font to use for a huddraw element, for individual player.

courier-16, courier-18, courier-20
facfont-20
handle-16, handle-18, handle-22, handle-23
marlett, Marlett-20
verdana-12, verdana-14
Delima-30 (SH & BT only)

ihuddraw_rect.syntax: ihuddraw_rect( Entity player, Integer index, Integer x, Integer y, Integer width, Integer height )
ihuddraw_rect.description:
Specifies the position of the upper left corner and size of a huddraw element for individual player.
The x and y position is relative to the position specified with the 'ihuddraw_align' command.

ihuddraw_shader.syntax: ihuddraw_shader( Entity player, Integer index, String shader )
ihuddraw_shader.description:
Sets the shader to use for a particular huddraw element for individual player.
shader can be the name of a shader or the path to the texture.

ihuddraw_string.syntax: ihuddraw_string( Entity player, Integer index, String string )
ihuddraw_string.description: Sets a string to be displayed. Clears the shader value of huddraw element for individual player.

ihuddraw_virtualsize.syntax: ihuddraw_virtualsize( Entity player, Integer index, Integer virtual )
ihuddraw_virtualsize.description:
Sets if the huddraw element (for individual player)
should use virutal screen resolution for positioning and size.

inventory.example:
local.inventory = local.player.inventory
local.inventory_size = local.player.inventory.size
local.item1 = local.player.inventory[0]

isadmin.description:
Checks if player is currently logged in as server administrator.
Returns 1 if player is logged in as administrator, otherwise it returns 0.

ldexp.description:
Returns the resulting floating point value from multiplying x (the significand) by 2
raised to the power of exp (the exponent).

leanleftheld.description: Returns 1 if player is leaning left. Otherwise returns 0.

leanrightheld.description: Returns 1 if player is leaning right. Otherwise returns 0.

log.description:
Returns the natural logarithm of x.

The natural logarithm is the base-e logarithm,
the inverse of the natural exponential function (exp).
For base-10 logarithms, a specific function log10 exists.

log10.description: Returns the common (base-10) logarithm of x.

md5file.description: Generates MD5 checksum of file with given filename.

modf.description: Breaks x into two parts: the integer part and the fractional part.
modf.example:
local.result = modf local.x
// Result
local.result["intpart"] // integer part
local.result["fractional"] // fractional part

netname.description: Gets player's name and returns it as string.

pow.description: Returns base raised to the power exponent.

registerev.description: Registers script callback handler for given event type (EventSystem Documentation). When given even type will occur, EventSystem engine will execute given script. The result can have one of the following values: 0 = Registering event callback handler was successful 1 = Event callback handler is already registered for given event 2 = Memory allocation error

runheld.description: Returns 1 if player is running. Otherwise returns 0.

secfireheld.description: Returns 1 if player is holding secondary fire button. Otherwise returns 0.

setproperty.description:
Sets property in local storage to given value.

Returns integer value:
0 - Success
< 0 - Error

Key and value can't be NULL.
If you want to clear the value, you have to set it to empty string.

sin.description: Reborn: Returns the sine of an angle of x radians. Breakthrough: Sine of float (expects degrees not radians).

sinh.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of x.

sqrt.description: Returns the square root of x.

tan.description: Reborn: Returns the tangent of an angle of x radians. Breakthrough: Tangent of float (expects degrees not radians).

tanh.description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of x.

teamswitchdelay.description: Sets the team switch delay time.
teamswitchdelay.example:
// Players have to wait 3 seconds until they can switch teams again
teamswitchdelay 3

traced.syntax: traced( Vector start, Vector end, [Integer pass_entities], [Vecotr mins], [Vector maxs], [Integer mask])
traced.description:
Performs a ray trace from start origin to end origin.
It takes optional arguments such as entity number to be ignored/skipped
by the trace, mins and maxs of trace box and trace mask.

typeof.description:
Gets the type of variable.
The type of variable returned as string (array, string, vector, listener, ...)

unregisterev.description:
Unregisters script callback handler for given event type.

The result can have one of the following values:
0 = Unregistering event callback handler was successful
1 = Event callback handler is already unregistered
